title: Good if you manage to get in touch with them
body: The staff are very good there and have sorted out everything I've gone to them with so far BUT: the phone lines rarely work; if they are working they're usually too busy to get through; when you do get through after trying none stop since opening, there are never any appointments left. I've been trying the phone non-stop since opening today and have not got through once (they're now closed and I've still not got through), I've tried the e-mail address on the website from two different accounts but it bounces every time and I have resorted to completing the contact form on their website now and am hoping to hear something back... Fingers crossed something gets through soon!

title: Awful practice
body: Been with this practice for years. At least an hour wait every time you call. Most likely there are no appointments available for the foreseeable future. I’ve been trying to get a prescription for 3 weeks now and keep getting passed from person to person over the phone without anyone solving it. They have lost notes on my consultations and phone calls before. Staff very unhelpful. Looking to change practises.

title: Disappointed, disheartening and rude!
body: I was advised by my health visitor to get in touch with my doctor regarding my daughter, when I rang the first thing I was asked ‘is it an emergency’ well believe it or not I don’t ring the doctors just for a chat! I was sent a link to send a picture to and was rang within 5 mins by the gp however the doctor was very rude and disregarded it without any reassurance to myself as a first time mum!

title: Poor Service Never Register at This GP
body:
Despite the poor reviews I still register myself just thought it could be  the opposite to the reviews online but they have met the expectations of people leaving the poor reviews. 

Booked an appointment two weeks ago for my early days of arthritis abs the staff over the phone confirmed yes it is book for the date and will receive a doctors call but after whole day gone no one has phone so I phoned back and ask why staff said there was no appointment book in system. 

utterly disappointed and gutted why I have register with them.

title: Nobody cares or listens
body: I'm so disappointed with the W+C hospital in Hull. The majority of the midwives are helpful but some of the consultants completely useless. I went yesterday and the consultant I saw was rushing me out after 3 minutes! Didn't even ask me how I was feeling! She wouldn't give me the chance to ask her the questions I had and only after I challenged her, she decided to give me 5 minutes. Asking or not asking my questions though, would be the same because the reply was "i don't know,  you'll have to talk to your designated obstetrician". What's the purpose of seeing someone random if they don't give me any answers? Plus making you feel like a burden and not as a patient and a human?

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Great experience
body: Everyone at the surgery is very helpful. They always provide a great service.

title: Uncomfortable
body: I have been with this practice for 3.5 years but have never felt comfortable with it. I have rarely seen the same doctor twice and while a couple have been attentive and helpful, one of the partners in particular makes me feel very uncomfortable visiting as he is rather brusque and dismissive, which is especially off putting when talking about mental health issues as I have. There are several signs in the waiting room referring to the surgery as a Christian practice and even saying that not all doctors are willing to prescribe emergency contraception. Both my partner and I find this incredibly uncomfortable as non-Christians and I don't feel it is right to connect religion with an nhs medical service.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Good practice
body:
Good doctors
Good nurses
Good staff
I am very happy with service all
The time, dr Paul is very good doctor.

title: No communication at all!
body: My mother is 74 with heart failure and housebound, my father has visited the surgery 4 times to ask when she is getting her vaccine and all they say is “ she’s on the list” no contact with my parents at all! Rude and unprofessional receptionist. Yes there’s a pandemic going on and you’re extremely busy but no patient care whatsoever, no communication. I have rang myself several times and phones constantly engaged, but it’s always like that! Appalling service. A letter was handed to the surgery manager regarding this and still no response!

title: ADHD Referral
body:
I was referred for an ADHD assessment by a previous psychiatrist based at Spring House, Biggleswade Hospital in Dec of 2018.
I chased this up several times throughout 2019 and can say for certain that it was confirmed that I was on the waiting list; long wait, but ok fair enough, thats to be expected.

However by mid 2020 my assessment had "gone missing". I have contacted PALS several times since Oct 2020 and they have put through to the Complaints Depart, yet no one has actually told me whether I am still on the waiting list for an ADHD assessment and so therefore I am stuck; I still need to be assessed for a diagnosis for a condition I almost certainly have, and I've no idea whether ELFT still intend providing that assessment or whether I will have to go private.

Basically I need to know whether I will be having an ADHD assessment or not.
It's not a difficult question, its either yes or no. 
If it's no than I will want to know why I have been taken off the waiting list and  by whom?

Thats my particular problem right now, but I have a long list of grievances over the past 5 years: missed diagnosis, non diagnosis and wrong diagnosis, which all amount to me being on the wrong medication for my conditions (which is why it is essential I have an ADHD assessment).

title: Excellent GP Practice
body: In the last year, the country and people have been going through a very difficult time with the pandemic and at a very stressful time for the NHS staff, we were experiencing difficulties to talk to our own GP. We were recommended through friends to join Fencepiece Road Medical Centre. We approached them in person and were pleasantly surprised by the reception team who immediately arranged for a quick chat with the doctor and we were registered in a few days. Our experience right from the reception, to the administrative team, to the doctor, was truly amazing and comforting. Harshad & Sujata Patel

title: Unable to get follow up appointment
body: Had great phone consultation earlier this month. Was asked to book follow up appointment 10 days later to check condition isn’t something more serious . Yesterday Spent 2.5 hours in a queue from 7.59 to 10.29 when I started out as number 5 in queue then gave up. Then called surgery twice more to be shortly cut off, and cut off again, it seems in afternoon. Éconsult just takes you round in circles telling you to call 111 who say call your GP. How can I get an appointment that was requested by a doctor? With thanks.

title: Phone system
body: Day 4 of trying to pre book an appointment with a gp to discuss blood tests. 5th in call list get put through phone rings over a hundred times only to be told by officious receptionist nothing available and to ring next day.you cannot come to reception in person even to pre book. Then tells me no further action needed! Appalling unhelpful recepionist and useless phone system

title: Very poor
body:
start with cons - no chance of getting an appointment at eight in the morning just a message telling you all our lines are busy then cuts you off. some of the staff could do with some training in manners, unsympathetic and rude, test result lost or incorrect , promises to call back but never do and when you ring them about it no one knows any thing about it , using corona virus as an excuse not to help , 
pro,s there isn't any possible the worse surgery in my this area .

title: Terrible
body: There’s needs to be a serious retraining session for the receptionists. Over the past couple of days I’ve phoned 163 times. I’ve phoned at 8.30 and been on hold for around 10-20 minutes. By the time I get through I can hear the receptionist but she thinks she’s still on the other call and hangs up!!! Then I have to phone again but by that time I’m stuck with a user busy phone screen and there’s no way of getting through until al of the appointments are booked. This has happened three times in the last week and it’s utterly disappointing. I’m going to be changing doctors surgery because of this because the stress of even trying to book an appointment is not worth it. The doctors are in fact good and able to help you out however 9 times out of 10 you won’t be able to see them because of the booking system. Disappointed

title: Terrible
body: This surgery is messed up i can never get an appointment. They say ring at 8 in the morning when i ring its engaged for ages then when u get through they r fully booked. It takes weeks to get an appointment reception staff is terrible.

title: Getting access is impossible
body: The website is poor and confusing and there is no way to sort out online bookings. There is also no way to arrange an appointment in advance, with appointments only seeming to be provided on the day, and for the half day, which means that if you can not get an appointment in the morning you have to ring back again in the afternoon, and the next day and the next day. I thought we'd been promised by the NHS, some time ago, that this approach was to be phased out. There also seems to be no appointments on the NHS App for the surgery. The Doctors and Clinicians might be great but getting to see them is a nightmare.

title: A sorry affair
body:
Frustrating and I'm afraid rude and unprofessional service. 
My Daughter and myself have been ringing since Friday the 19th of Feb and it is now the 24th of Feb, and still the phone system cuts off after ringing for a while, no message nothing just stops, then when they decide to activate the message service, its sorry no more room for messages please try again later.

title: Bad patient service
body: The receptionist i spoke to was very rude. Communication is poor between doctors and patients via phone. Was not told my appointment for my son was at the rear end of carpark in the rain. And was told I'm not suppose to be inside the surgery in a rude manner. My experience with this surgery was bad pre-covid. The receptionists need more training on how to be friendly and welcoming.

title: Absolutely disgusting
body: I didn't even make it there for an appointment because they can't make reasonable adjustments for patients with complex  mental health issues and ot other disability issues so therefore I will he seeking to out in an official complaint in relation to this matter.

title: Can't get an appointment
body: Impossible to contact surgery by phone - connection ends despite repeated attempts. No availablility to make appointment online "service suspended" is the notice posted by the surgery. Even their own website was "down" 23/02/2021. The inability to make contact with the surgery online or by phone is continuing. The surgery appears to be rationing contact as a means to manage demand with "phone problem" issues.

title: Excellent service
body: I recently needed the support of the team at Burney Street following surgery. They were absolutely fantastic, so dedicated, responsive, kind, and efficient. I can’t fault the care, and just want to say thank you so much, you are doing a fabulous job in very difficult circumstances (COVID pandemic).

title: extremely friendly and helpful main reception /…
body: Super friendly in the way they helped locate my daughter's ward...more than an exercise but with that all important concern which was so appreciated when going thru stressful times.

title: Great practice
body:
It’s my first visit at the practice today after moving to the area & changing surgery. Firstly they got me in very quickly for appointment after my own fault missing an appointment . The receptionist is always lovely on the phone when I’ve called asking lots of questions being new to the area surgery which I’ve not had before with previous doctor surgery’s. 
I was very happy with how much time the midwife & nurse had for me today. 
I wasn’t rushed at all, and she was very helpful on all my questions it’s actually my first midwife appointment I’ve enjoyed. 
So very nice to know my family have got a good doctors with the lovely staff too.

title: Great professional care
body:
I had a short planned stay after major surgery. From arrival on Eden Ward to leaving, my care was amazing!
I was always kept well informed, staff were efficient, considerate, personable, professional and friendly.
Nothing was too much trouble. The ward is very busy and staff are working so hard and excelled themselves despite being in the middle of a pandemic. 
I was regularly checked, meds and obs done regularly, I couldn’t have asked for more. From cleaning staff, to kitchen staff, to HCA’s, to nurses and consultants, all were efficient and delivered high quality of care! 
Only one criticism and negative comment is the hot food was diabolical, it really need to be looked at and improved. 
Overall I want to whole heartedly thank you for your care and compassion.

title: Lovely well organised
body: Very friendly, I was treated kindly and with respect, the treatment staff were very professional ,I would definitely recommend the practice.  The receptionist was really helpful.   No problems at all.  Thank you

author: conditionermy85
title: Well organised
body: I found it well organised and the people were very friendly

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bluepb87
title: First class service
body: (5 star) First Class

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: couragenz75
title: An excellent experience
body:
Excellent  
Well explained  
Well coordinated  
Courteous staff  
Reassuring and efficient  
Kind and caring to my husband

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: homameb44
title: My experience here today
body:
My experience here today  
All staff very helpful and friendly also people welcoming you in  
Very glad to get 2nd vaccine  
Hope it will help everyone to be safe in the future

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: octoberwf84
title: Efficient service
body: Very efficient

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: crateryg73
title: Vaccination
body: 😃 - Vaccination

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: rac
title: Care second to none
body:
I had an appointment this morning at ward 9 in Lagan Valley Hospital.  
I have to say the care I received was second to none. The doctor and two nurses that were with me were brilliant in reassuring me and explaining everything that was going on and made it a more "pleasant" experience.  
These guys definitely don't get enough credit for all they do. So this is just to say thank you and you are appreciated!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing support
body: I have been under the sleep clinic for a few years now and the support I have received has been amazing. The staff are so lovely and very accomdating. Nothing is too much trouble and pre lockdown they offered an outreach service so you didn't have to attend the clinic in person. They also tell you everything about sleep apnoea and support as and when needed. I can't praise the service or thank them enough. 😁

title: Covid jab - brilliantly done!
body: Fantastic set-up, fabulous team - especially the Security Guard and Manager who were exceptionally helpful - I feel very blessed :)

title: No Faith In Staff Anymore
body: I have struggled for a long time to put into words how I feel about this mental health trust. I have been under there care on and off for some time and I have zero faith in them given the standard of care I have received from them previously. I can’t reach out for help to anyone, not even my GP who is unable to do anything because I react badly to antidepressants, nor GMMH, because past experiences tell me why even try when staff don’t listen. They say speak out ask for help you are not alone, not true some of us really are very much alone in fighting our demons and our mental health. I agreed to a referral to secondary psychology services 16 weeks and still I have heard nothing. I am like a ticking time bomb waiting to explode and that terrifies me.

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

author: Soulgirl
title: I feel very let down by ORB
body:
So i have been working with One Recovery Bucks (ORB) for a little over a year now... i got clean from alcohol and cocaine and was abstinent for just over six months... i had a lapse a very small lapse and very quickly returned to being abstinent...  
A few months later my court proceedings were coming to an end and the pressure was extremely hard to deal with but i remained clean until the final hearing... unfortunately due to my mental health and ongoing issues that i still needed to tackle, my children were placed on a SGO and went to live my sister.  
So being on my own for the first time in 20 years i felt completely lost and helpless... unfortunately i fell back into using again, and immediately reached out to my key worker in pure desperation and despair. I was at the lowest point in my life i had ever been and had serious contemplations about ending my life.  
My keyworker told me that she was referring me back to be put back into structured recovery and i would have a new keyworker. At that time i felt a sense of relief that i was going to get help and my worries and fears were going to heard without judgement, as they were when i first joined ORB.  
I couldn't have been more wrong. I continuously contacted ORB trying to get in touch with my new keyworker and was told I had been assigned to a worker. I contacted them only to be told that it was them, but at the last minute i had to assigned to a different keyworker.  
I continued with my efforts to reach out as i knew i was getting worse and i was becoming even more anxious and my mental health was taking a very quick and serious plunge towards complete desperation. So finally after 2 and a half weeks of waiting and in between being sectioned, my keyworker contacted me only to tell me i would have to wait another week and a half before they could have the time to have a session and start work on a recovery plan with me. I'm still waiting.  
I can honestly say that i feel while working with ORB and I was clean and engaging to a very high level, doing up to 6 online groups a week ORB couldn't have done more for me. But when i found myself in a dark place and full of anxiety and depression and fear ORB, in my opinion, let me down massively.  
It pains me to type those words as i had always had great faith in them.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Sams
title: Upset by a rude member of staff
body:
I was admitted to Lincoln hospital as an emergency patient because of pregnancy dehydration.  
A member of staff asking questions was so rude. They asked like what is your point to your pain? which I didn’t understand and ask them to say again. Next time they was like shouting.  
A nurse asked them to bring me a nighty. They brought me one but it was like holding from one corner and without any polite, like shoot it to me.  
I discharged from hospital and next two day admitted again. Unfortunately that staff member again.  
Doctor helped me to lay on bed to examine me because of bleeding, and when finished the doctor went out and asked this person to help me. But the staff member gave me a box of wipes and said wipe yourself and put wipes and sheet under you into that bin. They were so rude, they went out, I did everything.  
This was the most annoying person I have ever seen in hospital.

author: Gigi300
title: Cancelled appointments
body:
My son has speech delay & has had 2 ENT appointments cancelled. Instead we had 1 phone call with the consultant.  
He needs to have a hearing test done with audiology, we are having a phone call, this is not good enough as he needs to be physically seen to have that kind of test done. (Ulster Hospital)  
He urgently needs speech therapy, he's had 1 zoom call & 1 phone call with them, then told it will be months before we hear from them again. (Armagh Hospital). This is absolutely not good enough as my 4 year old child's speech is falling further & further behind.  
We have faced nothing but major delays and cancelled appointments.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: bauldybob
title: staff nurse /nurses
body:
I was in a/e on thursday, my own drs receptionist told the wife to call an ambulance because it was bad chest pain. So called the ambulance which then took me to a/e who attended me and were caring drs and nurses.  
After seeing me, the doctor decided that I was getting put to cau which right from the start they were very unsociable and when attending me werent the way a patient should be handled.  
The next thing was the nurse come ojn the ward spoke to me onjjce then come back to me and said I was getting sent home so at that they veent away and a short tim later told me there was trransport arrainged for me and I was still feeling unwell but they come and said that was my taxi and said they would take my bag. this was after all the yapping at me and the doctor when he had co, me and said I was going home he said hes a deiff doc so im going home  
antway I was going out to the taxi and sliped on the wet ground and fell this nurse then walked awaqy and I asked them to help me up they took mmy housecoat by the neck and staryted to drag me up and was chocking me the way they was lifting me and was holding me like that all the way to the taxi and it was pissing down the taxi driver rerfuse4ed to take me as he looked at me and told them I still lookeed ill and I shouldnt be going home the way I was and I hadnt even spoke to him so he got back into his taxi and drove away so I had to go beck into tje hosp and sit on the seats near the door but knowing I had fell there wqswnt anybody come near me so the dinner was comming round and they compleatly ignored me sitting on the bed as I wernt back into the room and was lying there and the went bye me as if I was a sheet on the bed  
eventualy a taxi came and nurse had a brass neck to get me in a chair and take me to it this was the staff nurse after what happened but I was soken by the time I got home because of having to go out in the heavy rain for all the years ive attended thyat hosp ive never been treated like this I dont think they should be workimng with the public

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Pipdips
title: Breast care service
body:
What a fantastic, professional and slick service. Seen by Breast Care Nurse Specialist, Mammogram, Ultrasound and biopsies all in an hour and a half. Treated with utmost respect and dignity. Everyone introducing themselves and gaining consent. Explaining clearly, in layman's terms, what they were going to do.  
Big Thank you to Claire [Herlihy) Vicky (Student Mammographer), Sam, support worker and Mr Balvin. For your kind and professional treatment.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unprofessional
body: I came here for a midwife appointment. My appointment was at 1300, so got there at 1245 to allow time to do a urine sample etc. There was no one at reception when I arrived and the blinds were closed with a sign saying "at lunch - sorry for the inconvenience". Eventually someone came in around 1305 and checked me in. 5-10 mins later two more receptionists walked in. So three people  working at reception in an otherwise empty clinic, but none of them could be there on time to ensure they are available to check in patients with appointments? If a patient had arrived that late, they probably would have been turned away. The receptionist at the front desk then proceeded to have a very loud personal conversation on the phone, which she did not stop when another pregnant patient walked in and tried to check in. She had to go and sit down and wait to be acknowledged. I found the receptionists behaviour extremely rude and unprofessional. What's worse is this is clearly not a one-off. I had a similar experience a few months ago - my appointment was at 1415 and again there was a sign saying "at lunch". There were two of us waiting to be seen. Midwife eventually had the sense to come out and look for us, saying she nearly put us down as "did not attend" as she didn't know we were there. Not sure how that is our fault as there is no bell to ring to get someone's attention when reception is closed and despite me knocking on the door and calling out, no one came to assist. It is the responsibility of this clinic to sure there is a member of staff available to check patients in at their allocated appointment times.

title: Appalling
body: When an appointment was made and not kept by the doctor. A call back to recption to ask why, the reception staff said they didn’t know and the only option was to call back the next day to try and get another appointment. No acknowledgement that the doctor is just behind, no automatic re-scheduling for later in the day, no automatic rescheduling for the next day, no apology, no reason. Terrible service.

title: Vaccination
body: Excellent and well organised. Massive thank you to all the staff and nurses doing the huge job with all the covid vaccines.  Room full of angels. Thank you

title: Busy telephone lines
body:
It is extrémalo difficult to get through to the practice on the phone. Sometimes I spend 30 min and longer constantly redialling.once through, you have to listen to a general message for 1 and 1/2 minute and then you get in a queue!!  There is no other options to get an appointment with a doctor at the moment  
Also, this practice needs a good makeover as it looks very shabby

title: Good people appalling call handling
body: Nice people but on the last 3 times I have needed to make an appointment I have averaged more than 90 calls before I can even get onto the queue. I can’t imagine how people manage to see a doctor if they only have one phone (we used 2) started ringing at 07.59 finally got onto the call queue at 08.20 having made 107 calls, just not good enough.

title: DISMISSIVE AND UNRESPONSIVE
body: I have been disappointed with this practice ever since I moved to the area and in the last year their service levels have plumbed new depths and this is not solely due to the Covid pandemic but rather the new excuse for bad service.  It is practically impossible to get through on the phone - firstly you have to listen to almost 2 minutes of blether about why you shouldn't expect a service at all and how busy they are and then you hear what number you are in the queue - experience tells you that if you are more than 4 in the queue you will be waiting at least 15 minutes (and therefore likely to be cut off before anyone answers) - so when I heard 7 yesterday I hung up again.  The receptionists seem to think that their job is to make sure you can't see/speak to a doctor at all - and you only get nurse practitioners at best.  I think the word "service" seems to have passed this practice by - they forget that we pay for this service and that doctors are paid large salaries out of the public purse to provide this service.  I am so disappointed by the lack of empathy and efficiency offered by the practice and wish I could register elsewhere.

title: Very rude and unprofessional receptionist
body:
I was trying to book my wife 38 pregnancy appointment over the phone, the lady over the phone was rude and start shouting.
why you don't employ someone who can handle calls properly?

title: Admin needs customer service training
body: The receiving person was very good as was the person providing the vaccine. I couldn’t say the same for the admin person who barked at me when requesting details and then spoke about me as if I wasn’t there. Very poor especially if you were  someone who was anxious about the process !

title: Covid Vaccinations
body: My husband and I attended the Glenside surgery for our Vaccinations and it was extremely well organised and pleasant staff and helpers. Thankyou very much

title: Advice from Dr
body: The advice received from the Dr was so helpful as I was feeling very depressed.  He reassured my and helped me see the positive side to what is happening at the moment.

title: Covid Vaccination
body:
Just had my vaccination.

Everyone was amazing!!  Extremely well organised.  Very slick process from arrival, to injection, to waiting in a warm tent for 15 minutes

The team were all cheerful which helped to reassure.

I cant praise everyone enough!!!  Well done to everyone involved.

title: Poor communication
body:
I was told by text I would receive a telephone appointment and if it was inconvenient to reply via the same text 
I tried and it does not work 
This needs looking at urgently

title: Very well organised
body: went to Fitznells yesterday for Covid vaccine = so well organised. This was such a nice surprise - marshals on arrival, socially distanced queue well maintained by marshals, quick and easy check in, marshals inside, quick & easy vaccine, marshal to seat for 15mins wait after. Everything ran like a well -oiled machine and was a credit to all those involved in the process.

title: PROFESSIONAL + VERY GOOD INTERPERSONAL SKILLS
body:
Since the beginning of 2021 I have had a telephone consultation and visited the surgery on three occasions.
All staff, receptionists, doctor and Healthcare Assistant, have been efficient and pleasant.
I particularly appreciated the skill with which a blood sample was taken.

title: Made to feel i had wasted their time
body: I was sent to A&E for the second time from my gp with very high blood pressure.   The lady in triage said "why couldn't your gp have just increased your meds".   I felt like i was wasting their time.  An ecg was done along with bloods an bp brought down discharged back into care of GP.   If this happens again i wont be going.   The care I received was excellent but didnt feel like i should have gone.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well Done
body: Excellent organisation of the Covid vaccination rollout (ongoing) by Mayfield Medical Centre to it's patients. Well done to all at Mayfield (and staff working at the ERIC Centre).

title: COVID Vaccination
body: Fantastic, efficient service. Great staff ensuring all COVID precautions in place and adhered to. Very pleased to have received the jab in such safe and streamlined conditions. Thank you Westgate Surgery.

author: LaG
title: No female crisis line or team workers on duty - AGAIN
body:
This relates to two consecutive days recently when neither the single point of access crisis line nor the crisis team itself had a female worker on duty.  
Nor, according to the male workers answering the phone was there anyone anywhere in entire Trust to speak to. Not a single female crisis worker available.  
This is been a problem going back years. There seems to be a lack of understanding that women raped or abused ( as many with severe MH distress have been) cannot safely speak to a male worker. This Trust publicly claims to be expert in supporting women and trauma informed. This Trust claims publicly on this site, on FOI sites, on their website that a female worker is always available. This isn't about preference on a whim. It is about safety and not retraumatising and triggering vulnerable women when they are already in crisis.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Patient Care - Well Done NHS
body:
I would like to thank all of the NHS staff at Birmingham City Eye Hospital for the excellent care I was given during my time(s) 02/02/2021 & 15/02/2021 at the BCE hospital, especially in the current Covid circumstances.

All of the staff need to be applauded for the extra effort they have to provide to ensure that everyone is looked after well.

I hope that this positive review can be punlished & the sincere thanks will be passed on to all.

Kind regards,

John Jackson
RXK4480547

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: excellent smear test experience
body: I had a smear test with one of the Advanced Nurse Practitioners today. The procedure was painless which I have never experienced before and was very quick. The ANP was very confident and explained everything to me in a very clear way. I had put off having a smear for 7 years because of previous bad experiences at another practice. I won't worry about attending a smear test again thanks to the competence of the ANP

title: Brilliant vaccine service
body: Had my Covid jab here - brilliantly well organised with excellent friendly staff and volunteers. Thank you

title: Fantastic practice highly recommend
body: cheerful and helpful reception staff, very well run compared to previous practice, phone is answered very quickly and call is dealt with in a timely manner, if I could score more I would 😀

author: natmcvit
title: Wrong dosage of medication given
body:
For three days in early February, my daughter was kept in a Ward at Glasgow Royal Infirmary for minor surgery.  
She has been on medication for mental health issues that the staff of the ward was supposed to give her.  
The list and dosage of medication was provided by her psychiatrist. Before leaving my daughter in hospital, I also left a note with dosage and medications with staff.  
Next morning, I discovered that my daughter had been given a significantly lower dose of anti-psychotic medication and would have been given a lower dosage in the evening. The wrong dosage was recorded in the medical chart and had been entered by a consultant.  
If the wrong dosage had been continually given then my daughter's mental and physical health would have been in extreme danger.  
I made a complaint on that day.  
As of today (10 days later), I have received no feedback.  
I believe this to be negligent.

title: Marvellous treatment
body:
On the 8th February 2021 I entered Rotherham General for an operation to remove a cancerous section of my large bowel.
I have to say that from entering hospital to being discharged nine days later everyone I had contact with, in whatever capacity, were absolutely marvellous.  I was treated with great kindness and respect by everyone in both Sitwell Ward and Ward 5B.  Huge gratitude to all the staff.

title: poor appointment service
body: Walked to the surgery to make an appointment for a problem that is not getting better, spoke to the receptionist in sight through the intercom who said I have to phone for an appointment. The receptionist is the one who books the appointments and as I had taken the trouble to walk to the surgery there is absolutely no reason she could not do the appointment through the intercom without me having to enter. They were not busy and there was no one waiting to enter behind me. I find this very poor practice, so I will suffer in silence.

title: Vaccination referral
body: The NHS has been clear that doctors can refer patients for vaccine on an individual basis so that vulnerable people do not fall through the gaps of the overarching government classifications.  Why is this the only surgery which is refusing to do this in any case?  I know people in other surgeries who have been rightly referred specifically due to PTSD and M.E. as they did not fit the government criteria, but this surgery is flat out refusing to consider it for anyone!

title: Covid Vaccination
body: Friendly, efficient and well organised. Well done to all the staff and volunteers, it is very much appreciated.

title: sorry to say that this surgery is not good anymore
body: I have been trying to contact the surgery by phone for two days but no one picks up the phone , I need my repeat medication but no one helps me

title: Unpleasant experience
body: The practitioners and nurses working at the Bradley Stoke surgery are always a great help and provide the best service possible. Unfortunately I cannot say the same about the receptionists. Each phone call to the surgery is extremely unpleasant. The staff provided me with the wrong or misleading information on multiple occasions. I find the staff extremely rude and unhelpful. It seems that the process change on an hourly basis( depending who you’re speaking to). As a person working in the health services myself I find this unacceptable. Especially in the current Pandemic it is crucial to provide the best help possible as many patients are avoiding any medical treatments. This may have a huge impact on the public health. The staff should be pleasant to speak to. Please just be nicer.

title: Awesome, hard working and so kind!!
body: My experience of the acute assessment unit, gate 12, is one of high praise, the nurses work so hard, with tremendous patience and kindness and plenty of smiles that lift your mood and really help with your stay when you can’t see family or friends, anyone whose been in here see the tremendous workload they are under and how non stop there jobs are!! But they have made me so happy and I believe that speed’s your recovery, totally professional and go well beyond the call of duty...

author: victorsn66
title: A gp surgery
body:
I rung up my surgery to get an appointment regarding mental health.  
The second day that I couldn’t get one.  
So I told the receptionist it is an emergency ( which it is)  
They replied with-and what’s the emergency today? When I told them “mental health” they grunted,  
As if mental health is not an emergency. Well it is when you have been feeling like this for over a week. And now plucked up the courage to ring,  
They asked me my address ( I have recently moved but hadn’t changed it over yet)  
Went off the phone, came back and said -is that where you live? Now the only way they would know that I moved was due to unrelated personal connections with other staff from the same surgery. So clearly my name has been brought up. I’m now worried that my personal information will be passed on to them.  
I will be taking it further.

title: Great Practice
body:
Had my first covid jab today, it was a completely stress free experience. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and everything was explained to me clearly.
I have been a patient of this practice for over 25 years, and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

title: Great practice
body:
My husband has been quite ill over the past couple of years with bladder cancer, and other medical conditions which makes his health conditions very complex.
He has recently been diagnosed with OSAS which is obstructed sleep apnea syndrome which meant he had to give up his driving license, the doctors surgery has helped him sort out the paperwork which needed to be completed by a doctor ( AC ) also by the private medical report administrator ( PK ) for whom I am very grateful too. Thank you. 
The whole medical team  including the receptionists are very professional polite and friendly which makes them a great practice. 
Mrs P Brown

title: Very well planned and organised
body: First COVID jab, extremely well planned and organised at all levels, polite and kind service, excellently explained

title: Thank you very much for the excellent service.
body:
I had to visit the Minor Injuries Unit having scratched my eye cornea. 
From the reception booking in, through to the initial assessment and treatment taken I was totally impressed with all the staff who helped me. They were welcoming, understanding and so efficient in the way they helped me. I would like to thank them all for the tremendous help and support I received. I am pleased to report that my eye is recovering. We are lucky to have a great local hospital with exemplary people working there to help us all. Thank you.

author: KRS1988
title: Amazing GP practice
body:
The Lawson Practice staff go above and beyond to ensure patients are thoroughly checked and cared for.  
My children and I see Dr Raj who is absolutely amazing and skilled and knowledgeable and always makes time to ensure we are cared for to the best of her ability. She is personable and kind and thoughtful and I couldn’t ask for a better GP for myself and my children.  
I would also like to comment on Dr Tomlinson who went above and beyond to ensure that my very last minute health concern was checked properly. He was so helpful and exceptionally patient.  
This practice is truly an exemplary NHS service.

title: Caring Nurses & staff
body: I went here because I was very unwell. So I booked myself in at reception the receptionist was very polite and helpful. Then when I saw the nurse who took my pulse she was very kind and spoke very polite to me. People like that are the only ones who seem to care about you now days. I wish everyone was nice like that.

title: Great clinic, appalling telephone service
body: When trying to talk to anyone on the telephone it seems they are SO busy they're impatient to end the call, as a 70 year-old pensioner I don't like to be hustled.  I asked a simple question, have you changed my old address to my new house as I instructed when I came into the clinic December 2020?  The reply by the woman operator was "You have to put it in writing." I was never told this when I came into the clinic. The operator then said "You will find information on a change of address on our website..." Well I spent 1 hour trying to figure this out on my computer and couldn't find ANY answers, even if you put "Change of address" in the search engine on your site it says "no results found".  You've really let me down Cranleigh Medical Practice and I definitely wouldn't recommend you.

title: Very poor service
body: My family and I have used the practice for more than 40 years. Until recent times I would have described it as excellent. I cannot say that anymore. The quality of service has deteriorated to one that I would now describe as very poor. It takes 5 weeks to get a telephone appointment. The administration is condescending and very unhelpful. I have often given up trying to make contact by telephone. Recent experience has led me to question the competence of the the medical staff. I am really sad that I am having to say this of a wonderful practice that has been such an important part of my life.

title: Incompetent and rude receptionist
body:
Booked a appointment, turned up to say it was a hour after the time I booked, receptionist extremely rude, made a complaint still waiting .
Not the first time this has happened , g.ps great, admin staff terrible, one in particular needs retraining, booking appointments is difficult when they tell you one time then put you down for a different time

title: Awesome endoscopy team
body: I’ve had endoscopy at Harrogate and Pinderfields, the difference was remarkable for the same procedure, the team in Wakefield was like the comedy channel they had me laughing and so relaxed that the whole thing was just easy, and they found the issue, words to say but I’m looking forward to my next appointment in 8 weeks they were THAT GOOD, and is an uncomfortable procedure so to make me feel this way is incredible, I’m amazed by your abilities and how well you work as a team to totally relax your patients and make it FUN!! Really well done guys!!

title: Rubbish practice
body:
You can never get an appointment most of the receptionists are incapable of doing there jobs .
The doctor will just change your medication when ever he feels like it with no warning and they will just leave you weeks without pain medication .you can NOT speak to a practice manager even if you want to put a complaint in because she is always on leave !

author: cygnuskk75
title: I got my vaccine today at the stone treatment centre, craigavon hospital.
body: I was very relaxed going to get the vaccine as the nurses I spoke to (Olivia was one nurse) was extremely helpful and supportive. I got the vaccine and waited for 30minutes after. Every staff member was extremely helpful and approachable.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Covid Vaccine
body: I want to express my gratitude, also on behalf of my husband, to all the NHS team at Whalm Lane Surgery for the brilliant job  in running the flu vaccine campaign first back in November and for inviting us to have the Covid vaccine just last week. We feel very lucky and grateful for having had access to the jab being just over 55 years of age.

author: 77karl
title: Got vaccinated at Royal Victoria Belfast
body: Got vaccinated as care for elderly relative an staff where so friendly an caring at royal victoria hospital Belfast thanks an thank the NHS for a WONDERFUL JOB they all are doing 3 CHEERS

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: COVID Vaccine very efficient
body: A really efficient service, friendly and helpful and getting people through as fast as possible.  Thank you all so much...

author: delphinusbs58
title: A really bad experience
body:
I'm staying in the Royal Glamorgan hospital in a mental health ward, and it has been a dreadful experience, the conditions have just been really really bad.  
The staff don't seem to show any care about the patients. And they can be really threatening, so for example, I need a monthly injection, but in the first month I was here they injected me 5 times. Its because it feels like its used as a sort of threat, to threaten patients into behaving. So yeah, that happened.  
They don't ask if I want it. They just show up at my door, right in my bedroom door, with a big gang of nurses and orderlies ready to restrain me. No asking whether I want it - I do want the injection, I try to say that I will take it willingly but they don't listen and I get it forcefully.  
And the catering department - they often serve us out of date food - for example the puddings they give us, little plastic cups full of trifle, jelly, cheesecake, they have the date labelled on the top and it is usually out of date.  
The building itself is in a terrible condition, its been chopped and changed so many times. The windows have no curtains, just those office venetian blinds, so all the heat escapes out of the window and I end up freezing cold. And the en suites, the little shower cubicles we have, they have those swinging saloon doors that you can't lock - feels more like I'm in a cowboy movie and less like I am in a place where I can wash with any kind of privacy.  
And we have locks on our bedroom doors, but it doesn't mean we have any kind of privacy. The staff just walk right in and right out with out asking, without telling, without even knocking.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Corvid-19 Vaccination
body:
My partner and I visited the surgery for our first jabs on 19th Feb. My comments are about the organisation, the kindness of staff and volunteers. They can be summed up in one word: Faultless.
Thank you for a very relaxing experience.

author: emma299506
title: Covid-19 Vaccination
body: I received my first vaccination today in the Ulster. Nurse Tweedie was very thorough at explaining what was going to happen and putting my mind at ease, answering any questions I may have. I was anxious to get the vaccine as I am a primary carer for my disabled son. She was chatty and very understanding. The setup in the Ulster ran like clockwork and I felt very safe. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
It must be extremely difficult administering a practice during Covid, but the Doc's is doing a superb job. 

I logged my symptoms/issues on the surgery website Monday lunchtime, got a call from the Doctor Monday at 8pm. Had blood tests done Tuesday. Received a call from the Doctor Thursday morning with the results and have an in-person appointment tomorrow, Friday at 9:30am. 

That really is fast but it is also very reassuring that my issue is being dealt with so quickly. 

I can wholeheartedly recommend this practice, particularly as I have had recent experience with my late Mother's practice and my partners practice, and the Docs is light years ahead of those, both in terms of speed, empathy and treatment. The receptionists are kind, welcoming and efficient; the nurses are extremely good, and the doctors are spot on. 

Being able to speak to a nurse or doctor same or next day is fantastic at the best of times let alone during Covid. 10/10.

title: Excellent customer service
body: Had my covid vaccination last week, fast & efficient all the staff were amazing and it was nice to see the practice so happy and busy. This practice is and has always been a credit to the nhs.

author: kerI5
title: Fatigue Management Course was very helpful
body:
My name is JW and I have mild MS. I have just completed the NHS fatigue management course. I found it very enlightening and informative. Evelyn, the Neuro rehab assistant, discussed things that related to fatigue that I had not previously connected. She went through stress management at home and at work. Ways to relax, exercise and rest.  
Evelyn was very friendly and patient. Covering each topic clearly so that I would understand and re-capping to make sure that I did understand before moving on. She told me how I could manage any stress related situations at work. To take breaks whenever possible. How to exercise while at my table to relieve any stress that may be building up. She told me how to relieve any stress build up at home, again with exercise, healthy eating and sleep management. How to slowly incorporate it into my daily life so that it doesn’t become a chore.  
I have already started to do a little exercise at home and long may it continue. I feel now when I am a little stress, I have the tools to deal with it. 😊 Thanks you so much!!  
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

author: Lucyjc
title: Patient Contact during Covid Restrictions
body:
As unable to visit & phone calls arent quite the same my family were delighted to discover the Patient Correspondence Service offered by PALS in NDDH. We were able to forward on emails from friends, type our own emails & updates, include photos and pictures - send them into PALS who would then print them early the next day & deliver them to the ward, at no charge - although we would have happily paid. We always received an email receipt to say that our letter had been received and would be delivered which was very reassuring. PALS also assisted in arranging the delivery of fresh clothes & other items and the retrieval of laundry from their office - always friendly & smiling at a time of stress for us.  
Our only comment would be that these services could have been advertised more widely on the main hospital website or even a direction on the information given on the telephone answering service as we only came across this by chance when trying to trace some post that hadnt reached the ward. We are sure that more patients & families would love to be making use of this brilliant service! Thankyou.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding service
body:
Just wanted to say how amazing the whole team were from the Marshall at the entrance to sitting in the tent before I felt after having my covid Jab.

There was banter in the waiting room, which for me made it feel like we were all in this together.
Nurses were fabulous, infact everyone was.


It was quick, simple and very well set out.

Guy's keep up the good work!

You should be extremely proud of yourself.

What an outstanding team at Glenside.

Kind regards 

Charlotte Roberts

title: great practice
body:
I have been feeling unwell for some time and unfortunately the admin and one of the GPs at the practice proved to be an awful experience - i was made to feel that i wasnt getting anywhere... After several attempts at the e-consult, I eventually came across a lovely receptionist who took me under her wing and ensured i finally got a consultation with a  GP after 2 months of trying. 
She booked an appointment for me and spoke to me initially on the morning of receiving the call to assure i would have a phone consultation later in the day, i appreciated this very much. The GP i spoke to was very caring, attentive and reassuring. She asked lots of questions and took my concerns on board without making me feel rushed for time or dismissing my concerns (as i had previously experienced with the other GP and some admin staff) She recommended some further investigations and her calm and patient demeanour made me feel so much better. 
Soon after having the consultation, the receptionist who booked the appointment for me called me to ask if everything went ok. I was so pleasantly surprised to receive this call and really appreciated her concern.I just wish i hadn’t been through the awful 2 months of trying to speak to someone who would listen.. perhaps it’s a reflection of the pandemic and the stress that frontline staff are under, i wholeheartedly empathise as i am also a keyworker and the recent crisis has brought its own set of challenges. However, it is really important to not neglect the fact that individuals who are experiencing health issues should be given the quality care respect and dignity (which thankfully i eventually received ) that they deserve.

title: Marvelous Care
body:
I was an inpatient for 9 days on C31 thenC30.
I wish to praise the Medical teams,meaning Doctors and Nurses plus domiciliary staff .They were excellent in every way .Nothing a bother and I felt very blessed to be on those wards .Everything was covid aware ,making all feel safe WELL DONE Ward 30 and Ward 31 ! If I have to have surgery ,please God I don't need it ,I hope to be on those wards God Bless you all Stay safe Win. Warren.🌈🌈🌈🥰

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

author: quebecqw36
title: Birmingham St Mary’s Hospice
body:
My father was transferred to the hospice 3 days before he passed away from cancer. I live several hours away and due to childcare I had to bring my toddler with me. We arrived at the hospice and was immediately met with kindness and empathy. Throughout my dad’s final days he was treated with absolute dignity. The staff were supportive, friendly and even provided toys to keep my little one occupied.  
Every single staff member we encountered showed us kindness in our darkest moments - from the receptionist, the kitchen staff, the nurses and doctors. We were given lots of space as a family to just ‘be’ with my dad but at any point that we were worried or frightened they helped to support all of us.  
We had the family room which allowed me to stay in the hospice and be with my dad as he passed. It is the saddest moment of my life but I am so grateful to have been with him and to know that his final moments were with the ones he loved. The kindness of the staff after this happened is something that will always stay with me. My dad had so many years left to live and whilst we will never come to terms with his loss, I am grateful he was at St Mary’s. Thank you. It will never be enough. You helped us so much.

title: Complainant
body:
I phoned for an appointment this morning (25th February). When I said Dr told me to ring if necessary, receptionist said she would look on my records to see if Dr told me I could ring. When I told her I unable to do E consult she did oblige.
I realise the stress of events and appreciate this, but I take exception to being told they will look on my records to see what has been put.
Angela Duxbury

title: Covid-19 vaccine
body:
I am a patient at Stock surgery and I have never visited this venue. I attended today, 25th February, for the first jab. I was anxious but, my goodness, what a team...!
With military precision people were being processed in a fast, clean and safe environment. Everyone was friendly and each patient was made to feel important. Even after the jab was administered and sitting under observation for 15 minutes, I wasn’t forgotten....so well done everyone involved. I was so impressed.
If the normal surgery practise is as good as this I would highly recommend Whitley House.

Thank you very much.
